labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
I'm not sure if I understood your steps correctly, but I tried to verify the following two scenarios.
With only the **AdGuard Chinese filter** **enabled** and only **AdGuard - General** turned **on** in the system settings of Safari, the ads are blocked and the player fails to load.
With only the **User rules** (provided by you) enabled and **any** extensions turned **on** in the system settings of Safari, the ads appear and the player loads successfully.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 15.2.2 to 15.2.4
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/okonet/lint-staged) from 15.2.2 to 15.2.4.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v15.2.4

Patch Changes

  • 4f4537a Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix release issue with previous version; update dependencies

v15.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1407 d698162 Thanks @​iiroj! - Update dependencies
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

15.2.4

Patch Changes

  • 4f4537a Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix release issue with previous version; update dependencies

15.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1407 d698162 Thanks @​iiroj! - Update dependencies
Commits
  • 8be6c8e chore(changeset): release (#1419)
  • 4f4537a build(husky): fix release issue with Husky
  • 95d096d chore(changeset): release (#1411)
  • 72483cb docs: fix typo (#1417)
  • 86fba6f build(deps): update dependencies (#1418)
  • 1353320 test: add e2e test for linting difficult filename with ESLint + Prettier (#1413)
  • 28cc901 ci(release): disable Husky hooks in release action
  • d698162 build(deps): update dependencies
  • ab263ba docs: fix typo (#1408)
  • 6a14c53 chore(release): add empty changeset
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=15.2.2&new-version=15.2.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body: Better `against CNAME` => `against CNAME disguised`... (and below)

pull_request.title: [WIP] Remove cname tracker lists
pull_request.body:
Related: 
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersCompiler/issues/217
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/issues/946
Don't merge until this pr: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/pull/953
It would be a better to optimise the CNAME entries together with the blocked servers file, so that the broader rules that already exist in adservers.txt and tracking_servers.txt can reduce the number of rules in the CNAME lists.

comment.body:
I'd wrap it by Comment Anchors tags

* Beginning
```
! NOTE: CNAME disguised advertising networks
! SECTION: CNAME disguised advertising networks
```

* End
```
! NOTE: CNAME disguised advertising networks end ⬆️
! !SECTION: CNAME disguised advertising networks
```

And same for tracking.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/179763#issue-2309295389 not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
“Long response” is 2 days? I was going to respond today.

—Marc

> On May 22, 2024, at 8:33 AM, jellizaveta ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> Closed due long response.

comment.body:
Sorry, I misled you. I thought the player hadn't loaded because I couldn't see the progress bar and play button, and the black screen part of the player was also non-interactive. But I just discovered that the player did actually load. The player maximizes only when double-clicking on the loading circle in the middle, and it displays the message that the website has detected an ad blocker, then waits for 10 seconds before the video can play.
So the issue now is that AdGuard gets detected on a website.
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/20644119/60a1d7a8-6e49-4115-a3a5-5caf2537ccb9)

pull_request.title: [WIP] Remove cname tracker lists
pull_request.body:
Related: 
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersCompiler/issues/217
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/issues/946
Don't merge until this pr: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/pull/953
It would be a better to optimise the CNAME entries together with the blocked servers file, so that the broader rules that already exist in adservers.txt and tracking_servers.txt can reduce the number of rules in the CNAME lists.

comment.body: I tested AdGuard for Safari (macOS) with the filter enabled. If the main extension is activated, ad blocking works properly and videos play normally. However, if the main extension is disabled, the behavior on macOS is the same as on iOS: I need to double-click the loading indicator, then the player shows a message indicating that an ad blocker is detected, and after 10 seconds, the video will play. On iOS devices, even with the main extension enabled and the website having granted permissions to the main extension, I still need to manually double-click the loading indicator and wait 10 seconds before the video will play normally. It seems that the main extension on iOS is not working properly. _The main extension I mentioned is shown in the pictures._

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Hello, please add these rules to the custom DNS filter:
```
@@||googletagservices.com^
@@||tpc.googlesyndication.com^
```
These domains cannot be unblocked in the main DNS filter
